meanings.definition: Relating to the origin or development of a disease.
meanings.sent1: The pathogenetic factors were studied to understand how diseases start.
meanings.sent2: Doctors investigate the pathogenetic aspects of illnesses to find better treatments.
meanings.sent3: It was a pathogenetic puzzle trying to figure out how the virus spread so quickly.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenetic nature of the outbreak was like a hidden thread weaving through the community.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenetic process was like a map leading to the source of the infection.

meanings.definition: Causing or capable of causing disease.
meanings.sent1: The pathogenetic bacteria were responsible for the outbreak.
meanings.sent2: Avoiding contact with pathogenetic substances can help prevent infections.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenetic potential of the virus made everyone cautious.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenetic impact of the contaminated water was alarming.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenetic nature of the illness was a reminder of the importance of hygiene.
